isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - ADJUSTMENTS - CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 5000i SERIES BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1997

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 5000 i SERIES BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1997
svcproc.para: To adjust cab ride height, measure ride height from top of air springs (bags) to bottom of air springs (bags) between left and right cab mount plates and suspension crossmember bracket (Figure 180). If dimension does not meet specified height of 4 1/2 inches ± 1/16 (114.3 ± 1.6 mm), adjust as necessary using the following procedure.

figure.caption: Figure 180. Cab Height Measuring Points for Cab Air Suspension System for 5000 i Series before September 1997

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 181 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove one end of height control valve linkage (Item 1) from threaded ball pivot (Item 23, Figure 118) by unlatching linkage clip and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot.
Loosen one of the jam nuts (Item 2) and back off the nut several turns.
Turn the height control valve linkage (Item 1) clockwise to shorten the linkage or counterclockwise to lengthen the linkage to adjust the linkage properly.

important.para: There must be a minimum of 5 full threads engaged between the threaded rod and the linkage socket. If a longer valve linkage is required, contact Link Manufacturing customer service for assistance.

step1.para: Height control valve arm (Item 3) has a slot (Item 4) which will allow for course adjustment also.

figure.caption: Figure 181. Cab Air Suspension Height Control for Cab Air Suspension System for 5000 i Series before September 1997

step1.para: Reconnect height control valve linkage (Item 1) onto threaded ball pivot (Item 23, Figure 118) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place.
Re-measure the cab ride height, if necessary, continue to make adjustments until proper cab ride height is obtained.
When the height control valve linkage (Item 1) is properly adjusted, latch the linkage clip and tighten jam nut (Item 2). Tighten to Hand tight + 1/8 turn.
